description: Variant of Platonic, which see. The sense “non-sexual” dates to the 17th century in English, and to the 15th century in Latin; see platonic love for details.

adjectives.description: platonic (comparative more platonic, superlative most platonic)

entries.meaning: Neither sexual nor romantic in nature; being or exhibiting platonic love.
examples: They are good friends, but their relationship is strictly platonic.

entries.meaning: Alternative letter-case form of Platonic (of or relating to the philosophical views of Plato and his successors).
